LLM01.name: Prompt Injection
LLM01.description: Malicious inputs causing unauthorized actions or data disclosure
LLM01.mitigation: Input sanitization, system prompt locking, output filtering

LLM02.name: Insecure Output Handling
LLM02.description: LLM-generated code/content creating vulnerabilities when executed
LLM02.mitigation: No eval/exec, sandbox execution, output encoding

LLM03.name: Training Data Poisoning
LLM03.mitigation: Data provenance verification (out of scope for AGENTSECURITY.md)

LLM04.name: Model Denial of Service
LLM04.mitigation: Resource limits in runtime section, max_autonomous_steps

LLM05.name: Supply Chain Vulnerabilities
LLM05.description: Vulnerabilities in third-party libraries and plugins

LLM06.name: Sensitive Information Disclosure
LLM06.description: LLM revealing PII, secrets, or confidential data
LLM06.mitigation: Secret scanning, PII detection, output filtering

LLM07.name: Insecure Plugin Design
LLM07.description: Plugins performing actions without proper authorization
LLM07.mitigation: Tool allowlisting, scope restrictions, declaration enforcement

LLM08.name: Excessive Agency
LLM08.description: LLM taking autonomous actions with unintended consequences

LLM09.name: Overreliance
LLM09.description: Users trusting LLM output without verification

LLM10.name: Model Theft
LLM10.mitigation: Access controls (out of scope for AGENTSECURITY.md)
